reviews.text: Nice place to walk, but needs more parking.  We had to wait for a car to leave so we'd have a place to park.  And it would be fantastic for people to be responsible and pick up their own dog's poop!  Looooots of dog poop there.  Overall a nice walk in a convenient central location.

This is a good place to take a break and walk in Fairbanks. During the spring and fall migration it can be an excellent place to see waterfowl and sandhill cranes. The end of Aug and into the first few days of Sept are usually the best for the cranes.
It's hard to put a rating on a public space. Great migrations. Nice waterfowl. Cool barn. Too much dog poop! It's really disgusting.

We always love this place. You can walk on trails in the winter, they have a luminary walk around Christmas, ornament making out of wood slices, they do kids activities, animal track identification, summer birding and nature walks, star watching night, and in the summer after the water from the snow recedes, you can walk the long back trails and hear frogs, climb the lookout towers, see sandhill cranes (and visit the weekend long crane festival), and in the spring you'll see hundreds of Canadian geese, swans, ducks... It is a beautiful place. Lovely open fields, cute visitor center converted from the farm house, friendly staff.
We had a successful ice fishing morning here. The area had ample parking pullouts and restrooms. It should be nice any time of year.

Wonderful experience! First timein my life at a hockey game and I'm 35. Only issue was, the children were left unsupervised and were acting violent and disrespectful. Other than that? 100%. Thank you for this experience!

We had a lot of fun watching hockey games here. There are a few options for places on the upper floor to buy snacks and drinks, some places offer alcoholic beverages, and others everything from hot dogs to popcorn. The place itself isn’t the cleanest, but it is a hockey stadium so that’s to be expected. A lot of people go there for the games. I suggest getting to the games early so you have an awesome spot to watch from and you can get parking close by.

The Big Dipper is an awesome staple to the Fairbanks community, you can walk in the upper area and the skating rink is an awesome place to come when the weather outside doesn't permit outdoor skating.

We came for the recreational skating on a Saturday afternoon. It wasn't overcrowded. Adult fee is $6.00, plus $3.00 for skates rental. Be sure to check their website for hockey match schedules and private events to confirm rec. Skate times. We definitely had a blast, and I'd highly reccommend for anyone looking for a way to spend their afternoon. 
Kids seemed to love the rink as well and there are several options to help them learn how to skate and prevent falls.
Comfortable place with Great People. It's a Hockey Rink!
Good place to go any day of the week.
Very friendly, welcoming and helpful congregation
Great congregation, family friendly and loving. Bible based on all they do and teach.
Some truly awesome believers!

I love coming here after distance runs.  I get an Oregon Chai and it's the perfect pick me up.  The folks there have never been anything but friendly and have made recommendations for me before that never disappoint.  I also really enjoy the ambiance there as well.  It reminds me of the coffee shops back in Charlottesville.  Very upbeat, yet refined.  Very, I'm gonna date myself here, "hip" but classic at the same time.  Kinda has the feel of an amalgamation of an Italian espresso bar mixed with college area coffee scene.  The service, as stated, is friendly and quick.  No issues coming there from Wainwright after PT and getting back to get changed before 1st work call.  Great little spot.

Big place inside to come and sit down to do your own thing without being disturbed. The coffee is pretty good but the food prices have skyrocketed the past few years and the desserts always seem to be hit or miss depending on the person who makes them.
Good coffee, good atmosphere,  great background music. The service was quick and courteous and the variety of coffee and nibbles is good.
Love the space and the people but somethings can cost a little more than yould think
A very crowded place people came in. All day long I was there visiting Alaska, in Fairbanks enjoyed the coffee

Best restaurant in Fairbanks! Beautiful scenery along the river. I had the blackened halibut which was amazing and my dad got the red deer and it was also delicious. We plan on returning again before we leave Fairbanks. We also shared the elk sliders and they were very tasty. The apple pie was good.

Definitely not worth the craze. The service is good. The food is average. The Elk burger is nothing to rave about; it was too salty and overcooked. The parking lot during the winter is a death trap. With the prices they charge, I was not satisfied.

We went to the Pump House for dinner on the last night of our vacation in Fairbanks because we have read numerous reviews of this place and wanted to try it out. 

The service was absolutely fantastic. Our waitress was very energetic and talkative. She gave us a good rundown of the menu. 

We specifically avoided other “ordinary” choices on the menu since you could easily get steaks and king crabs anywhere else. We wanted to try something exotic and different. As a result, we ended up ordering the elk meatloaf and clams with reindeer sausage.

To be honest, I could not tell any difference between beef and elk and reindeer meat. The reindeer sausage tasted just like any other sausage but there were only a total of 4 small pieces of sausage in our plate. The elk meatloaf was the same as any other meatloaf we had before.

We were not impressed probably because of the high expectations we had when we walked in there. The service was fantastic, the vibe and atmosphere of the interior decor was one of the kind but the meal itself was alright.

Certainly a fine place for dining choice in the area. We ordered the cod and the deer meat, both are good choices. The waitress was super warm and enthusiastic. Also loved the decor with a feel of local culture.

Great dining experience! Reindeer steak was delicious, tender, and cooked just right. The creme brulee was light and delicious. Highly recommend for a special occasion for the price is at the higher, fine dining range. My wife and I will definitely be returning again.

Good yummy food.  We had chicken fried rice, Tom yum soup and drunken noodles.   We also had the coconut ice cream. I suggest you try it if you like coconut. It was very delicious and sweet. Good service. Nice staff. Nice place.

I'm a fan of Thai food and enjoyed the food at the Lemongrass restaurant each time I've eaten there.  The menu had a good selection of appetizers and entree's, and service was good.  The seating is a bit crowded.
This is my go to restaurant everytime I  come to Fairbanks! Great pad Thai and I  loved their curry when I could eat shrimp. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Definitely worth the trip...
Hands down the best Thai food in town. I traveled extensively in Thailand and the food here was exactly the same as in Thailand. Highly recommend this place for an authentic experience.
This place has amazing Thai. They use locally sourced produce as often as possible and rotate their specials to reflect what's in season. It's always consistent and the service is great.

Rarely give 5 star reviews, but after 5 years away from Banff this place is still the hidden gem I remember. Tom yum second to none, prices are possibly the best value you will find in Banff. Traveled from Toronto with my gf who lived with me in Banff five years ago, and the first place we needed to go for dinner, we agreed, was pad Thai restaurant. So glad we made the trip back, and foods as great as we remembered! Wishing only success and plenty years of delicious food service ahead.
Delicious food! Wonderful service and prices that match the portions.
The food is really good and the staff is friendly.
Delicious Thai Green Curry, great prices, highly recommended
I was here Dec. 2017 so it might have changed since then. My visit was very pleasant and the food was very good! I has rice noodle coconut soup and it was so good!

We have experienced the best ribs in fairbanks, it was off the bone was so satiating. Most especially, our male server was very friendly and timely with his order. He ensured we had something to eat and drink right away. We felt bad to forget his name but he was a tall guy. Overall, Service, food and place was excellent!:)

The service was amazing 😍, the food was spot on!  The seafood fettuccine had more seafood then noodles! 👍 The flat iron steak was flavorful and just like butter! ❤️. And last but not least.....the carrot cake was moist, and not overly sweet.....the most perfect meal! ✨. Coming back tomorrow for Sunday Brunch! 😁

The food was good for fried food. I thought the price was too high for basic food. If you like a casual dining experience it will be fine. I was there during the winter months when the deck was not open. I think it can be more lively during warm weather. I would like to come back and try for a hole-in-one. Guest can hit a golf ball from one side of the river to the other to try to make a hole-in-one!

$49.99 for 3 kind of crab, mussels, sausage, and corns. Come along with lemon,butter, and bread. 
The seafood’s fresh, the sausage’s delicious. 
Before I headed to this place. I saw the picture of this dish was $39.99, but when got there, it’s not as that. They said for 2 people but I think for that amount, it’s only for one person. So a little pricy. 
They view was very impressive, looked out at the windows, it could see the river(snow at that time)

Ate a late lunch with a coworker. Service was fast and friendly. Food drove the 3 stars for this review. Had the applewood bacon burger. Nothing really special about it. Very middle of the pack when it comes to taste and quality. Pike's has been around for a long time. I would stick with their dinner menu. If your looking for that "slap someone so good" burger I would bypass Pike's.
